issues.description: The problem statement explicitly says the birthday should be stored as an ISO-8601 formatted String, but both the template and the solution define the birthday attribute as java.time.LocalDate and the tests use LocalDate (e.g., setBirthday(LocalDate.now())). This is a type/representation mismatch: students reading the problem statement may implement a String field or attempt to treat birthday as String, while the provided codebase and tests expect LocalDate. This will cause confusion and prevent students from following the provided templates/tests correctly.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the representation consistent. Preferably update the problem statement to state that the birthday is stored as a java.time.LocalDate (and that its JSON representation will be an ISO-8601 formatted date) so it matches the template and solution code and the tests. Alternatively, if the intent was to use a String field, change the Person class, repository, tests, and related code to use String for birthday and handle parsing/formatting accordingly. The first option (adjusting the problem statement) is the least disruptive given current code and tests.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the REST endpoint using the path prefix '/api' (e.g. 'PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents'), but both the template and solution controllers register endpoints without the '/api' prefix (they expose '/persons/{...}/parents'). This mismatch can confuse students when they try to invoke or write integration tests for the endpoints described in the exercise, because the path shown in the problem text does not match the actual controller mapping in the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the endpoint paths consistent. Either update the problem statement to refer to the actual paths exposed by the controllers (e.g. 'PUT /persons/{personId}/parents') or change the controllers to include the '/api' prefix (e.g. add @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...) at the class level) so the code matches the problem text.
